name: Chicken Pad Thai with Peanut Sauce
author: Anthony Murphy
summary: I made this chicken pad thai for my wife on her birthday and she loved it. Make sure to pick up medium rice noodles.
ingredients: 1 (8 ounce) package medium-sized dried rice noodles
1 ½ cups 1/2-inch wide strips of raw chicken breast
3 tablespoons canola or peanut oil, divided
¾ cup chopped unsalted dry-roasted peanuts
directions: Place noodles in a large bowl and cover with cold water
Combine soy sauce and cornstarch in a bowl; stir to dissolve cornstarch
Place chicken in a separate bowl and pour soy sauce mixture on top
Mix together 1/4 cup sugar, fish sauce, tamarind juice, and lime juice in a saucepan over medium heat and simmer for about 5 minutes
Heat 1 tablespoon of oil in a second skillet over medium-high heat and add chicken
Cook until no longer pink in the middle and juices run clear, 5 to 10 minutes
Reduce heat and keep chicken warm
Heat remaining 2 tablespoons oil in a large wok over medium heat
Add garlic and eggs, stirring to scramble, about 5 minutes
Add cooked chicken and stir until well mixed
Add drained noodles and stir until warmed through, 5 to 10 minutes more
Stir sauce, 3/4 teaspoon sugar, and salt into noodle mixture in the wok
Stir in peanuts and chili powder
Remove from heat and top with chives
Serve pad thai with bean sprouts on the side
